statement:
Suppose $V$ is a proper analytic variety in an open set $U \subset
{\mathbb{C}}^n$ (that is of dimension at most $n-1$) suppose that
$f \colon U \backslash V \to
{\mathbb{C}}$ is holomorphic and further that $f$ is locally bounded in
$U$ Then there exists a unique holomorphic extention of $f$ to all of
$U$.

If $V$ is of even lower dimension we can in fact even drop the locally
bounded requirement, see the Hartogs extension theorem.

[9]{} Steven G. Krantz. [**]{}, AMS Chelsea Publishing, Providence,
Rhode Island, 1992. Hassler Whitney. [**]{}. Addison-Wesley,
Philippines, 1972.
names: Riemann's removable singularity theorem in several variables
